title: Wrong `sync_committee_bits` value from beacon block rpc on kiln testnet
body: ## Description On kiln testnet, `sync_committee_bits` value from beacon block rpc always is `0xf7fffeefebd6ff6faf7ffffd7dfffffe6ff6bfbfffdedefffffff7fff5f77dace7fffb7fddffaefdfffffeffefffbdfffffbe6fb5fffb7fefd7f3fffffffbffb` the value would not change. This seems to be an obvious bug. ## Version stable ## Present Behaviour shell script to reproduce it ```sh ~ curl -X GET http://127.0.0.1:5052/eth/v2/beacon/blocks/651772 -H "accept: application/json" | jq -r '.data.message.body.sync_aggregate.sync_committee_bits' 0xf7fffeefebd6ff6faf7ffffd7dfffffe6ff6bfbfffdedefffffff7fff5f77dace7fffb7fddffaefdfffffeffefffbdfffffbe6fb5fffb7fefd7f3fffffffbffb ``` ## Expected Behaviour The correct value should be `0xefff7ff7d76bfff6f5feffbfbeffff7ff66ffdfdff7b7bffffffefffafefbe35e7ffdffebbff55bffbdf7ffff7ffbdffffdf67dffaffed7fbffefcfffeffdddf` ## Steps to reproduce ```sh ~ curl -X GET http://127.0.0.1:5052/eth/v2/beacon/blocks/N -H "accept: application/json" | jq -r '.data.message.body.sync_aggregate.sync_committee_bits' ``` If you change the block N, the result would not change.

This isn't a bug in Lighthouse, that's how sync committee bitvectors are encoded. The spec defines bitvector serialisation here: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/ssz/simple-serialize.md#bitvectorn.

The 0xf7 at the start of the bitfield corresponds to 0b11110111 in MSB-first binary, or 0b11101111 in LSB-first binary (which is what your screenshot of the explorer shows). Either way, this bitfield means that all sync committee validators in positions 0-7 signed the message except for index _3_.

You can convert from the serialised form to the bits in increasing order form using an expression like this (Python):

```python
"".join(format("{:08b}".format(byte)[::-1]) for byte in 0xf7fffeefebd6ff6faf7ffffd7dfffffe6ff6bfbfffdedefffffff7fff5f77dace7fffb7fddffaefdfffffeffefffbdfffffbe6fb5fffb7fefd7f3fffffffbffb.to_bytes(64, "big"))
```


There are cross-client standard test vectors that stress the hex-encoding and SSZ serialization here: https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/tree/stable/testing/ef_tests
